page.title: 01Between E Tytherley/Broughto
page.content: The area is mostly farmland with some deciduous woodlands. The landscape is attractive being undulating, the fields largely bounded by hedge rows with clumps of deciduous woodlands. The farms & woodlands devoloped over many centuries with little change tto landscape. In the southern part the landscape developed as state parkland with several large lebanom ceders. In recent years farming practice has changed from large scale dairy and arable to mostly arable. Whereas most people until this change worked on the land, fewer people are now required. Cottages are now increasingly occupied by newcomers, who are mostly commuters or in retirement. Area thinly populated some ninety folk taking in part small village of east Tytherly.
